eprint.title: Disk-dispersal and planet-formation timescales
eprint.note:
© 2008 The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences.
Received 11 March 2008, accepted for publication 14 March 2008. Published 16 July 2008. Print publication: Issue T130 (August 2008).
Special issue: Nobel Symposium 135: Physics of Planetary Systems (18–22 June 2007, Lidingö, Stockholm, Sweden). Physica Scripta T130 http://www.iop.org/EJ/toc/1402-4896/2008/T130
eprint.abstract: Well before the existence of exo-solar systems was confirmed, it was accepted knowledge that most—if not all—stars possess circumstellar material during the first one-to-several million years of their pre-main sequence lives, and thus that these systems commonly have the potential to form planets. Here, I summarize current understanding regarding the evolution of protoplanetary disks.
